alert.note: Alert for Lapeer; Oakland (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 5:48AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms in portions of Lapeer, eastern Oakland, Macomb and St. Clair Counties through 645 AM EDT... At 547 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hadley to 6 miles northeast of Pontiac to near Warren. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds near 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Warren and Sterling Heights around 550 AM EDT. Rochester and Clinton around 555 AM EDT. St. Clair Shores, Mount Clemens and Macomb Township around 600 AM EDT. Lapeer around 605 AM EDT. Romeo around 610 AM EDT. New Baltimore, Armada, Dryden and Lum around 615 AM EDT. Imlay City around 620 AM EDT. Richmond and Harsens Island around 625 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Anchorville, Franklin, Keego Harbor, Goodland Township, Waterford, Shelby Township, Ray Center, Utica, Auburn Hills and Lake Angelus. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
